bibRefCitation.author: Evans
bibRefCitation.refString: Evans, H. E. (1967) New generic records of Bethylidae from South America. Proceedings of the Entomological Society of Washington, 69, 269 - 272.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Aspidepyris austrinus
Evans, 1967
: 270
–271 (male description),
Evans, 1973
: 201
(additional specimen);
Gordh & Móczár 1990
: 69
(catalog);
Azevedo 1999 b
: 14
(genitalia description, additional specimen), 15 (figs 8, 9).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. MALE. Length 2.3 –5.0 mm. Body (
Fig. 1
). Color: head and mesosoma black, metasoma dark castaneous, mandible; antenna and legs castaneous to dark castaneous; forewing subhyaline to infuscated. Mandible with three apical teeth, upper two teeth short and rounded, lower one long and sharpened. Clypeus with median lobe narrowly trapezoidal or subrounded, median carina almost complete. Antenna thick, segment III as thick as long. Frons nearly polished, punctures small and sparse. WH 1.02–1.09 × LH, WF 0.47–0.52 × WH, WF 0.9–1.03 × HE, OOL 1.0– 1.19 × WOT, posterior ocellus distance from vertex crest 0.25–0.43 ×
DAO
. Head conspicuously narrowing posterad. Vertex slightly convex, corner rounded. VOL 0.46–0.57 × HE. Elevation of pronotal disc low posteriorly, with posterior margin concave and somewhat fused to posterior margin of disc. Notauli very thin anteriorly and wide posteriorly, distance from each other less than their width. Parapsidal furrows straight, incomplete anteriorly and touching posterior margin of mesoscutum, closer to lateral margin of mesoscutum than to notauli. Scutellar pits subcircular to circular, not touching lateral margin of scutellum. Propodeal disc with paramedian carina straight or slightly curved mesad posteriorly. Genitalia ( Figs 2, 3 ): paramere weakly to strongly constricted basally, apex widely rounded in apical half, dorsal margin slightly straight and ventral margin strongly concave; volsellar digitus with minute teeth at upper margin; cuspis laminar, with sides parallel, long, shorter than paramere, apex rounded and arched inward; aedeagus about 0.6 × as long as genitalia, apex not aligned with cuspis apex, wider below apex and constricted medially. FEMALE unknown.

Aspidepyris austrinus
